review: This Applebee's needs to be cleaner and needs to hire nicer staff/waiters without nasty attitudes. The food is mediocre, and other Applebee's are better. Oh and the waiters don't even check your ID when ordering alcohol, which is beyond awful.

The waiter was pleasantly professional and nice. Rare when it comes to these chain restaurants.  We ordered off the 2fer deal. 2 "full size" entrees and 1 shared appetizer. (As per their menu) Um my entree was more like a kids meal portion. Heck even my niece got more fries than I did potatoes. I ordered the bourbon chicken and shrimp with roasted potatoes, the chicken and shrimp had good flavor but the potatoes were bland and very greasy. And again - a VERY small portion. Anyway, glad I tried it.. now I know. I go to this mall all the time, so I won't be back unless it's for drinks.

I've been a regular of this place and I loved going here until my last recent visit during a hangout with my friends. First of all, we been sitting there for 30 minutes with no acknowledgement at all. Then when we ordered, the food took awhile as well. Looking around for our server to get our drinks refilled took so long because she's nowhere to be found and by the time it came, it came with the dessert. I don't really complain how long the food takes when hanging out with friends  but the moment that I had to pay on their tablet and this woman went ahead to decide how much I'll put as her tip (in that case 20%) which she does not deserve and left right away while I'm stuck on signing the tablet with my signature. I wouldn't mind tipping her that much if she deserved it, but no. Then she had the nerve to put that much tip herself?

My friend and I had a very good experience with the QCM Apple bee. The waiter was so nice and she was constantly checking up on us to see if things are okay. I forgot her name but she was super nice and pleasant. The price was really good. We go the three appetizers for 18 bucks and got the 2 entree for $27 with one size appetizer. We though it the three appetizer was a sampler, so a little bit of everything. But it came out to be three full size appetizer. My friend and I were full just with the appetizer. Good food and good service
Long wait. Poor service. Poor food quality. Not a place to go if you expecting better than that
Good fast food type of restaurant. They have good and affordable food options. We got the 2 for  $26 included 2 entrees and an appetizer. The Fiesta lime chicken is delicious and artichoke dip.

Waited who knows how long for someone to come acknowledge us. Could see it was pretty packed. Eventually someone came by. I could tell it be a long day. My daughters were annoyed. Practically falling asleep. After working since the morning this shouldn't have taken so long. Ordered from the 2 for 27 menu. I ordered a quesadilla. About 20 mins later the appetizer cane with my food. Then the girls food came. Really sad. We ate just wanted to go. The waitress asked how we were I was more in an annoyed state of mind. What do you expect. This was the longest meal ever. If you can't take care of the customers you have why keep sitting them down.

The menu looks promising,  like multiple visits are needed to try all the meal choices. I had the Taco soup and it was very good and tasty. Then, I was very satisfied with the Chicken Quesadilla Grande. It was REALLY good and tasty, more like excellent. You know when you are trying to find a new meal with a new flavor, this was IT. It was so good that I ordered 2 of the same thing. I Absolutely  have to come back and try everything in the menu. I tried the dish with the Steak and shrimps, it was good. I did not liked that the size of the steak was too small and the shrimps were extremely salty. I down graded to 3 stars. My 4th visit, I took a special friend here on her lunch hour. They were very late in serving the food, they were not that busy. The waiter had to be called a few times because he was chatting with his co-workers and not paying attention to the tables. The food took wait too long to come so my friend had to be late back to work.
Happy hour is from 4PM - Close! $5 Margaritas  1/2 off appetizers what more can you ask for?

Worst Applebee's ever...especially bar section took them about 10min to even make eye contact and then it took so long to be acknowldge by the waiter who we had to call over to give us menus. When we called her over she had a very bad attitude as if she was bithered that we called her over. I was so upset I didnt orser anything at all.

One of the worst Applebee's I have been to. Came here for drinks before at the bar and it was fine so that's why I'm giving 2 stars.  The restaurant had at least 8 free tables but there was still a 20 minute wait. Waitress was rude, forgot we ordered ice tea and never brought it. Forgot we ordered appraisers so it got to our table after we got our main course.   Ordered the 2 for $20 deal, I had the chicken tender,  the chicken tenders were the size of my finger length and width wise. Very small portion.   Waitress kept looking the other way every time I wanted to hand her the check.

Horrible service. Hostess was unfriendly and had a puss face. Then the waitress screwed up our drink orders. Then she screwed up my boyfriends dinner order and neglected to adjust the bill accordingly.  After wasting 2 hours of my life in that ghetto hell hole our bill was in excess of $80. And for what? 2 gross cocktails that tasted like water, a salad and a sandwich, That is absolutely freaking ridiculous and obscene. We could have gone to a real restaurant and spent the same and went home with at least a buzz and satisfied tummies. NEVER AGAIN!!!! This place is gross, ghetto, trashy, the service is awful and the drinks and food are disgusting and not worth a cent. Go somewhere else!!!!

My little son Jonathan LOVES this place. Although the service is on the slower end,we enjoy the food. The food is basic American but very tasty. The steak is very good with vegetables as sides but I've tried mostly the whole menu. Jonathan and I always get the melting molten cake, sometimes we order and ear that cake before the food....it's delicious !

It was pretty affordable except the food took forever to come and we were just eating chips and salsa until we were nearly full. even refilling out drinks took forever. They didn't even clear the appetizer once the main dish came nor they did check up on us. We did the two for $20. The spinach dip was great and the salad was alright. The ribs weren't that good.

Doesn't even deserve one star. I'm not a fan of Applebee's anyway, but walked  in there for lunch at 1:00 on a Saturday afternoon due to a family member who insisted on eating there. I used the restroom before my meal came, and it took away my appetite. DISGUSTING!!!!!!!!!!!!  I assumed it hadn't been cleaned overnight because I couldn't for the life of me believe that it could get so gross before 1pm!!!  Don't eat here unless you are really desperate. If the bathroom looked like that, I don't even want to imagine what the kitchen looks like.

TERRIBLE SERVICE. Only had one server that was ever really worthy of a great tip (Jasmine). All other servers seem lazy and unprofessional; rather be socializing amongst each other than waiting on guests as they should be. The food is typical Applebee's food, no complaints there. But overall the service is 1 star. I'd suggest avoiding this Applebee's and going to one of the many other chain restaurants in the area as they all have proved to be way more worth it.

Wasn't too busy on a weekend afternoon, oddly enough. Got seated in a booth.  Yuuum, I liked their honey bbq boneless wings. I should have ordered more to go! But the portion was smaller than expected, because it was one of those promo prices/things.  Fried shrimp platter was crispy.  Good go-to food when you're hungry and know what you're getting-- not high end or exotic food here people.
Applebee's located at the Queens Mall shopping center.  I've been here a couple of times and service is always slow. Food is like any other Applebee's restaurant.

Fire the staff in the back, if haven't already!!!!!! This is a late review but I still can't get it off my mind. I went there in June with my family for a little celebration. Normally, I would go for a bacon cheeseburger but that night I decided to change it up a little and ordered a "well done" steak. Upon arrival it looked good but once cut opened it was red and bleeding in the middle. -_-  I DIDN'T eat it.  Now,  I am not one to really complain or send back food & have my night ruined over an uncooked steak. So, I just pushed the steak to the side and ate the potatoes. Still, wishing that I would've stuck with getting my "norm",  I decided to ask my waitress (Who's the only reason why this place would even be given stars) for a bacon cheeseburger to go. Before walking out my TO-GO bag was given to me  and silly me didn't even bother in checking it until the next morning.  In my defense, I always order a bacon cheeseburger at other locations and it never changes.....BOY was I WRONG! When I opened my bag the next day to reheat the burger I was shocked to find UNCOOKED French Fries and GROUND BEEF (literally) slapped in between the bun. Never have I ever experienced this at any other AppleBee's location. I am always given a patty & cooked fries! Not straight up ground beef that looked like they just pulled out of  its package and grilled for two minutes on both sides!   -What was in that bag was disgusting and a violation. Frozen fries? Uncooked Ground Beef? Who's working in the kitchen? The Health Department needs to close this location down!!!

I have never had a great experience in Applebee's. The food portions are so small and the service is consistently mediocre. For dinner the place definitely cannot compete with any respectable restaurant. The upside of Applebee's though is the pricing. Most of the dishes are very cheap. They have combo deals and many other deals tucked away in the menu. If you work near an Applebee's it is a great place to go for break or after work for drinks. You'll end up saving more money doing that as opposed to going to any other restaurant. I'd describe Applebee's as a low quality, but low price restaurant.

false advertisement!!! no dollaritas!!!! I think Applebee's should be a bit more clear in their advertising. I came here under false pretenses and now I am sitting here without a dollarita.  Naomi is a fantastic waitress. She is very helpful and accommodating.  I take back everything I said.

Came for lunch we ordered two sangrias which were pretty good the boneless bbq chicken wings kinda dry no real chicken flavor to it the main course was butcher meat and potatoes dish and the stir fry steak with garlic mash potatoes very hearty and filling good sauce to the dishes
So for a birthday I came here. Ordered wonton tacos - delicious and savory. The steak was cooked perfectly and the potatoes were amazing. Tea was watery. The service was great. Overall good place.

Went to chow down on a feast of grub with a friend last night. Got a ton of stuff. Struggled to finish it all but we put a good dent in it. Eriel was our server and was lovely, everything was great. They had $1 Long Islands which I got to take advantage of a few just before they had to close. Happy campers all in all!

I went here for lunch based on the $9.99 All in lunch special.  For $9.99, you get a choice of one of their signature burgers, a side and a drink.  What can I say?  I'm a sucker for nationally advertised food campaigns.  You probably save $5 with the lunch special versus normal prices.  I ordered they the tablet on the table.  I preferred this method over a waitress because you can more readily see what you can add or take away on your sandwich or choose as a side.   I got the brunch burger which had a fried egg, hash browns and bacon with a side of fries.  The burger was good.  It was actually done medium as I requested.  The fries were over salted but otherwise okay.  When I was done with my meal I used the tablet to pay.  It was very convenient and got me out of there quicker than waiting for my check.  I was able to be in and out within 30 minutes without feeling rushed. I'm giving the food 3 stars, 4 stars for value and 4 stars for service.

My fiancé and I came here last night 12/15 at around 8:30-9pm after a long afternoon/evening of shopping. We were HUNGRY. We usually love Applebee's and their service but this time it was a miss due to a bad apple. We stepped inside and waited by the entrance behind 2 girls who were also waiting to be seated, about 5 minutes go by and the girls are escorted by a short hostess to their seats. We continue waiting another couple of minutes and a family enters and stands  behind us on line, the hostess returns and called over the family who just entered over to their table completely bypassing us as we were standing in FRONT of that family there is no way she could've missed us. And if she was unsure about who was next why not ask? We stood there dumbfounded waiting a few more minutes for her return and then my fiancé says to her - you know you skipped us. And, her response was "well i don't know sir they said they were next", which was a complete lie, we saw her call them over without asking any questions. She doesn't apologize but, we let it go while she's walking us over to a table, points to it and turns around and walks away and before we get to it or get a chance to sit she's gone. We look at the seats and it's dirty, open salt or sugar packets, straw wrappers and a tissue were on the seats. Fiancé refused to sit and he said we're leaving and I was disappointed and right behind him. Short hostess saw us walking out and didn't ask us any questions.  All of that waiting for nothing. It's safe to say i will not be returning if this is how staff treats guests.

The services are ok but the food are horrible. The boneless wings are ridiculously salty and it look like it's leftover from last week. The butcher meat and potato the beef are dry and tasteless. And the firecracker shrimp cavatappi is just like a salty Mac and cheese with dry and over seasoned shrimps.

I have ate here few times. I love the burgers and my favorite spinach dip for appetizers. I haven't tried a lot of the menu but I do like the lime chicken with rice and the quesadillas. They do have great deals as well. It is a great place to eat when you quickly decide to go out. Go ahead and give it a try, their service is great! Plus you have the mall to hang around later.

Food is ok, took long time for food to come, and too expensive, I don't want to pay a lot of money for food that isn't worth that much money, but I have to say the food was tasty, chicken tenders, came here few days back, thought of posting this review.

I don't eat here, but to grab a beer or two with coworkers after softball (we play right across the street), it's convenient and serves that purpose. and I can walk home! bartenders are decent and the draft beer selection is pretty standard. being at an Applebee's in a shopping mall is a bit too "Real America" for me, I'm sorry.

Usually have a decent time here,  staff is pretty friendly. Food is usually ok but occasionally you'll get ur burger pretty much raw or ur spinach dip watery if they're really busy. Drinks are good. It's in the mall so most times there is a small wait time.

A breath of fresh airafter leaving Olive Garden and their unprofessional staff..From the moment my family and I entered it was pleasant vill town. Hostess was kind and all the time had a great smile. Brian (manager) seated us and was so pleasant and had small talk with us.. wanting to know how we where doingthe service is already great and I love how attentive they all are.. as I was going to write a review noticed that they were rated a 2.. I was surprised .. I can't even imagine a 2 I recommend Applebee's (Queens mall).. and ask for Brianhe is awesome... Loving my food right now
They advertise $1margaritas. Well that's not case in queens center applebees. They don't participate. Very annoyed because I came here purposely for it. Never again.

Came for a weekday lunch and the staff was wonderful! They were so friendly and attentive to all customers. There was a woman there who clearly was a regular and I noticed that all the servers would stop and chat with her, one even taking the time to sit and with her for a minute. The smile on the woman's face was priceless. I would highly recommend this location.
They seem to think white people don't eat mushrooms or onions. The waiter looked at me like a white girl is not gonna eat bourbon chicken.

I'm a regular here! This location has NEVER disappointed me! The food always is fresh here, and there's always a big portion of food compared to other Applebees!  The service is great here too! But just don't come here late at night, because the waiters do get a bit rude, and start putting up their chairs and trying to get you to hurry. But, the food still makes up for it here! Big portions, and always great tasting here!
Great place for casual dining in Queens. Good food, friendly service. Great price. A bit crowded with some waiting time.

I came here with my cousin around 11am-12pm so it was empty. Even though it was empty, they made us wait 15 minutes for a table. It didn't bother my cousin and I because she wanted to shop till she drops (literally) anyways. We came back and we got our seats right away. They kept their words!  Our waitress was so nice. She kept coming back every 3-5 minutes to check up on us. I don't remember her name but she made us felt welcomed and we had a great stay. I got bbq ribs and it was amazing! I would definitely recommend their ribs mmmm. I forgot what my cousin got but I remember it was fish. She didn't like it so she mainly ate the appetizers.  I really love the interior design of this apple bee's. Their wallpaper was the history of Newtown High School. Even though Newtown High School don't have a pleasant reputation, they made the school LOOKED like a great school back in the days.  I'm hoping I'll have time to come back here. I really had a great time. I miss their food! I recommend this place to large groups. :)

It's an Applebee's so nothing should really be a surprise to anyone. The food is ok. I'd stay away from having steak here though. I ordered it medium and it looked like it was cooked to medium. But the texture of the meat was dry and chewy. Stick with having ribs here. The tablet that they put on every table is good and bad. If you have a child, be careful because it's very easy for them to get to the games which tacks on $2 to your bill. But what's great about it is that you can pay directly on it. No more waiting for your server to get you the bill, wait for them to take your credit card, and wait for them to return with your credit card. Just swipe, sign, and go.

This server s great ! He knows how to handle his table, Experience and knowledge of foods, recommend us the apt and main course they are all so good, today is no wine since long drives be back to home but I love coming back queens and stop here from r buzz.

Of all the chain restaurants Applebee's is one of the better ones but not this one. I've eaten at this one a few times since it happens to be in the Queens Center Mall and let me tell you the service here is horrible.  Every time I come here I get the feeling that I'm in some kind of popularity contest and if they like you, you might get good service. I know that might sound like a little bit of a stretch of the imagination but every time I've come here there has been some customer lodging a complaint about their service. Is that a coincidence? I think not! While were there this time we witnessed the table next to us being seated right around the time we received our appetizers and they still didn't receive anything but their plates when we had finished our entire meal and my son and I are slow eaters. That's pretty bad! I'm talking about a good half an hour of waiting just to place their order. That's ridiculous! I felt bad for them. At one point I was tempted to say something but I didn't for fear of being punished by our own server who was already giving me looks of destain for having asked for a glass of water. Seriously, the people in this place need to take a class in social etiquette. We didn't even receive so much as a "good night or thank you for coming!", instead I said it for them hoping that I might get some response but they just looked at me as if I had three heads and all of them were green. Dah!
do not order the chicken wonton tacos!!!!! I was vomitting the whole next day. NO GOOD!.

They are a hit and miss IMO. I think the best part about them are their Appi's and happy hour. Their entrees are all pretty salty so that's a turn off for me. Service is what  it is. Unhappy employees make terrible waiters. With that said I believe they have potential  to be much better. Come on guys broken chairs and hip hop over the radio? You fail...

I would probably say 3.5 stars but because the other reviews are killing the overall score I'll round up to help my old stand-by restaurant out. Applebee's is one of the best chain restaurants, way better than places like Chilis or Red Lobster. Applebees is a tight chain so even though I'm reviewing this location they're all the same and the workers here are the practically the same as anywhere else. Even though this location is located in the Queens Center Mall it's got its own entrance on the side of the mall and stays open even after the mall is closed.  Applebee's has some decent food like their french onion soup, boneless honey bbq wings, and most of the other items are done pretty well (amazingly well for a chain). Don't forget their 23oz Brewtus beers either. Applebee's is a good choice if you don't want to try and find a new place to go and want better food than a dive without spending too much. Although their desserts like the cheesecake or bread pudding are very tasty you can go to Baskin Robbins, Dunkin Donuts, or Cinnabon right next door if the mall is still open.
Terrible staff, slow and they don't bother paying attention to what you're ordering. Kinda rude too. Food is ehh. Cold when it arrived. CHANGE THE USELESS WAITERS AND WAITRESSES!
Just ate here, If you like expencive junk food this one is the best:)
Craptacular! Ordered  medium got well done. My drink was so watered down it was shameful. Two fingers up, just not the thumbs.
Like other chain restaurants. Okay good. Food is good. Blah.

Avoid this Applebees at all costs! I would not even give them One star! Yelp only lets you post reviews if you select a star - This Applebees at Queens Center Mall deserves a Zero!  Their service is slow and unprofessional. I was a party of 3 and we ordered the Cajun steak and shrimp, spinach dip app, and the sizzling chicken. The App took forever to arrive and there were only a couple of chips. The entrees were cold our steak was raw and chewy and the potatoes were raw. Plus they charge you twice for flavored lemonade, once for the drink the other for the flavoring. All in all our bill came out to $80! $80 dollars and the food was soo poor. I complained to the manager about the quality of the food and he just shrugged his shoulders and didn't even offer to comp us for the two lemonades!! This place is horrible, also dirty! Beware, if you are hungry at the Mall go somewhere else! This place is awful!!

Prompt service, especially since my wife and I went on a Sunday at 10 pm. The hostess and waitress were amazing and always had a smile on their faces. The food was excellent and hot!  We'll come back for sure!

i was in area after seeing a buddy in queens and figured some end of the season college football. inside the queens center mall on queens blvd, and in main level, the place is nice size with the typical applebees decor. walked right in and told the hostess, i will sit at bar, then as i saw the crowd and not being a bar person, i just seated my self in a secluded booth with a nice size tv right in front of me ,great now get a server to notice me, cause it took a while for her to come, not her fault , i seated my self in a hidden corner, she finally came by the nice sweet girl and now time to get down( i mean ordering food and drinks). i am aware that( ab. ) has a rep of having salty food so i picked carefully, i went with the welfare deal 2 for 20 one app and 2 entrees( what a pig i am). not bad at all, mozzarella sticks was decent, no frozen after taste and oriental chicken salad and chicken tenders basket. both were good, not salty at all , but chicken tenders were a little to crunchy, no big deal ,only regret no room for dessert, i am stuffed. a nice applebees with friendly staff, decent food, and comfy booth, with clear view of tvs. the place has a casual sports bar restaurant feel which is just what people enjoy.

Orders: Nachos with Spinach and Artichoke, House Sirloin Steak, and Riblets. Loud music in the background. May be good for lazy days, but not for intimate dates. Service was ok. Food was so-so. Nothing surprising for my taste buds. Food tasted generic and commercial.
It's a bigger Applebee's than the one in Fresh Meadows and its great that its in the mall. The food was okay and the waitress was very friendly. Nothing spectacular ...

This place sucks. We had a coupon, and the manager said he honored it after looking it over for over ten minutes. He then took us to our seats. Within five minutes of ordering our food, he came back and told us he wasn't going to accept our coupon anymore. We had to sit there annoyed and frustrated that they couldn't have told us in the beginning to avoid any of our time being wasted. Service also sucked. Appetizers took forever to arrive. Even getting a glass of water took ten minutes. Will not be back here ever again.

Wow the service is horrible, there putting one course on top of the other and when you first sit down they rush you for your order but forget to bring your napkins or a plate to eat your first course over, very mis managed.

I'm been coming to this Applebees since it opened back in 2004. Personally, I never had any problems with this place before.  This applebee's has a full bar and it's a pretty decent social area. There are nice decorations all around and it's overallness is pretty decent. Nice sporty atmosphere.  Their food is above average for frozen food and their burgers are quite decent; it sure beats the crap MCD across the street from the mall and within the mall. To really test this restaurant's style, dont order something with cheese, cheddar, or any sauce. Sauce and Cheese tend to overwhelm the food's actual flavor. I tried the grilled chicken steak and i was satisfied. The chicken was moist and tender while it was chewy and delicate. They offered me garnish and sauce but i denied it because it would be a waste of my money putting it on flavor enhancers.   I would recommend this applebees to anyone. They have good staff, good food, but slow service, long wait for food and to get seated. You choose =) Brought to you by Inside Spoon =) Happy Eating!

It's Applebees, so it's unreasonable to expect gourmet food. The service was decent and the service was decent. I've been here several times, and there was never anything wrong with the food or the servicce. It's nothing exceptional, but is the best option if you want sit-down food while shopping at Queens Center Mall.

I had to go to Applebee's to try their 10oz Brewtus Steak Burger. A great name, and too enticing a description (10 ounces of chopped sirloin topped with cheese and bacon) to let this burger pass me by. The actual experience, however, was less than spectacular. In fact, I barely want to write (home) about it. Perhaps they really do use chopped sirloin, however it must be really lean sirloin, as the full 10oz patty has no juice to it what so ever. Part of the dryness could be due to the fact that they don't (as per company policy) cook medium-rare / rare burgers, so I ordered mine to medium doneness. What's the use of having a 10oz burger if it's dry? Applebee's Fries: The crunchiest fries evar! They keep their crunch even an hour after they're fried, amazing. Leaves me scratching my head, wondering what they do to achieve that extra crunch factor; maybe they use the double fry method? Anyhow, besides the crunch factor, there's also some flavor to these fries, and they are decent sized as well. I went in expecting some run-of-the-mill fries, and I left impressed by their offering. Revised from 2 stars to 3 stars on 5/7/08 on account of their kickass Honey BBQ wings. Read on... Honey BBQ Wings These wings are gooood. Get them. Savor them. It's not often I find myself chomping, sucking, and licking through my meal in such an uncouth demeanor. What can I say? It's the wings; they bring it out in me. The meat is that familiar juicy dark meat that we all love. The sauce is smoky sweet, and more importantly, just right. It's done so right that I find myself slathering more sauce (from the plate) onto the wings, gleefully licking my fingers dry. Dry! The wings are a good size as well. Not too small, not too big. ps: these wings are better than "The Colonel's" honey bbq wings. Citrus Terriyaki Wings Too salty for me. There's asian twang, tropical citrus flare, and, unfortunately, too much salt (i.e. soy sauce).

This Applebee's is crap.  I've been here a few times.  I once walked out after NO ONE came to our table after 9 minutes of sitting there.  No acknowledgement or anything. I've eaten here a few times and had a decent time.  The help is cold, but timely.  So...I'm cool with it.
I have no problems with this Applebees. the food is decent. the prices are reasonable. the service can be slow though.

They did it again. 9oz rare steak came back raw two times..really! . Looks like it was cooked in the microwave. No grill marks and looked grey. Served in the same plate,didn't even take steak off to cook it. I asked for mashed potatoes and got rice again.  Rice looked like rice pudding with cheese mixed in.Un appetizing to even look at. The third time I got the steak back it was well done.Still in the same plate with my original first slice mark Two strikes your out...oh the fried string beans were great. That's all I landed up eating.  Microwaving a steak it a huge NO!
Service wasn't too bad. Kind of slow but the food was decent. Nice people. its ok overall

Very good restaurant.  I come here very often and it's always very good. I would say out of 50 times maybe they're was maybe one time that it was not up to expectation as far as being taken  care of. Overall can't judge for a one time thing. It's  big place good food and very respectful workers. Good job..
Sat at the bar when I went. Got the frozen margarita for happy hour. Asked for a little more touching up on the drink because it tasted like ice. Food was good and the bartenders were helpful.

If I crave a burger and absolutely can't wait and can't get to any other place because applebees is two blocks away from me - then you can find me here. I haven't tried their "smash burgers" (ingredients like onions, pickles, and bacon are "smashed" into the beef so it's all mixed in), but the classic one doesn't disappoint my craving. Chicken wontons are good too.  Other than those two items, I don't come here often because.. well... it's a chain restaurant and we're in NYC where there are soooo many other places to try.

The food was okay but expensive for the little bit of food you get. The appetizers were good but you don't get much of it. The drinks sound good in your ear and pretty on the menu but it's very watered down and for a price tag for $14 I could go walk over to BBQ's for a texas size drink for $10 and walk out stumbling and singing lol. However I LOVE the fact that they do have TV's and you can watch the game there but I just wish the drinks were a little better. Every good game deserves a great appetizer and a dope drink :)  Do I recommend it? "Yes"... BUT only to watch the game or just during the lunch time because  you get more bang for your buck.
Good service today. Vanessa was bar tending and I guess last time we ran into bad ones. Her and Lauren did a great job. Thx girls.

THIS IS A PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT... AVOID THIS APPLEBEES. First off I think writing a review on Applebees is absolutely LAME, but I feel the need to do this! If I could give this Applebees a half star I would! Their service here is horrible. They brought the appetizers together with our food which came 1 & 1/2 later. The steak was raw and not well done.  Simply terrible.

I love their boneless chicken with classic buffalo sauce. It is the only reason that i gave 4 stars. Server was fine. We had couple of old people and a baby in our group. Everybody was satisfied. Because, our expectation wasn't so high from a classical American diner. The only negative thing is that steaks was not cooked how we like.

I havent been to this Applebees in a while I used to live in here when I first moved to Queens but has since moved on to bigger and better. LOL Nah, its a clean restaurant and staff are okay. I went in for take out and sat at the bar for my food. There were a lot of people there for the happy hour specials and if I didnt have a lot bags I wouldve stayed for it too. I ordered my riblet and fries and walked home. Food was good as usual and I would always return.
Good quick service. Female waitresses good.  Male waitress cold and unfriendly.  Food is good. Drinks are good. Atmosphere  relaxing. Nice Saturday or Sunday afternoon lunch.
The portion sizes are really small for the prices they are at. Service takes very long, stayed waiting for a while to just order the food.

The cook was horrible... I came here for my birthday with my kids and hubby.. I called on my way to bees to make sure after 10pm the appetizer was half price Jessica answered and said yes when I get there the waitress tells me no half price finished at 7pm.. The waitress was nice but she was covering this location for the night I paid $16 for some chicken fingers and fries for my daughter the chicken fingers were soooo small and looked like the chicken was sitting out and then deep fried b4 serving we asked for 3 well done burgers.. So I thought the burgers were bloody and disgusting.. When I told the Waiter what in the world was going on she brought out one little chicken finger which looked like a chicken nugget.. I will never go back to this place...

Absolutely awful service. It began with the hostess making me uncomfortable with the fact that I arrived by myself. I received my food quickly, but I had to ask another server for silverware. Upon receiving my drink I had to find another server for a straw. Finally , I was sat in a small dark corner when more, well lit, seating was available.

Mom and I tried this place again after our annual beauty day. I guess the next time around was better for us. We were seated right away, our waitress was friendly and attentive, and the food was pretty good. Overall we had a good time. Not so bad.

Applebee Elmhurst, NY (Queens Mall)- I usually go to the Applebee in Fresh Meadow on 188 St. but since I was at the Queens Mall we stop by this Applebee for a meal.  I guess my expectation of consistency of service and quality was wrong.  There were not a lot people in the place but it took the waitress a long time to come over. Then the flatware she gave us still had food pieces from the last customer and the second set was a little better but still not clean. The waitress was annoyed with us when we asked again for another set of flatware. The salad appears to have been seating around for a while and not as fresh the other Applebee I go to. We finished our meal and went back to shopping but I will probably skip this place the next time I am hungry.

Sat nite and the service was prompt. Loved the shakes we ordered. They are running a great combo deal as well. Lots of TV and you can see them from all the angles. I loved the service. There can be a wait some times for the table but if you are fine sitting at the bar then usually you will find space.

Theres nothing spectacular about any other major chain restaurant but because of the location, I come here pretty often. Like 3 or 4 times a month.  I usually come here for the Happy Hour special, 1/2 off appetizers and $5 alcoholic drinks but when you buy many appetizers and get that many drinks, you're just missing out on a balanced meal and spending about the same price.

I come here all the time after a break from shopping at the mall. The service was quick and fast. The lady who served us was really nice. This apple bees I feel is smaller then the other ones I've been too but that's just because it's in a mall. The service was really good. My boyfriend told me he was about to order another drink( lemonade) and she walked by and put a lemonade drink on the table. We didn't even see that coming. I was like is she psychic and we laughed. I like that theres deals you can choose from. We tried the 2 for 20 the food tasted great. I had the steak but I couldn't finish it was too thick and my bf had the chicken and pasta. She gave me a little container to let me take my food home. I liked that. She was a very nice person and I could tell she was working very hard. She talked to us nicely and made our stay welcoming. We'll probably keep going there just because there's good service and good deals :3
I came with my family it took forever to serve our table finally they took our order and still made a mistake I was disappointed because the previous menu was change for the new menu

The only thing I like about this place is that it's never a wait to get seated ordered a large strawberry Margarita it came up 11 dollars I was like whoa will never order that there again other chain resturants serve the same drink for like 7.50

Considering the odds, our experience wasn't half bad. I mean, it's what you would expect - strollers, teenagers, muffin tops, birthday singing, sticky menus, hard water stained silverware, and the list goes on.  But the worst part was probably the wait - both to get a seat, and for our food. We ordered from the $20 for 2 entrees and an appetizer, which we agreed was a great deal.  We had the spinach artichoke dip for an appetizer, and then the oriental chicken salad and chicken pasta. The dip was pretty good, a good amount of spinach, creamy, hot, with melted parmesan on top. Lots of homemade, thin crispy tortilla chips, and salsa. The dip came out right away, about 5-10 minutes after we ordered. But the food, took at least 30-45 minutes, which is not really acceptable considering how simple it was.  However, the salad and pasta were pretty great too.  The salad was not overdressed, and it wasn't too salty or fatty either, a pleasant surprise. The pasta was creamy and had great flavor. Our server was nice and attentive.  Overall, this was a great introduction to this chain restaurant.

This AppleBees is situated right inside the Queens Center Mall and can be entered from the outside or from inside the mall. In the adjacent parking lot, they have signs for Applebees parking, but I'm not sure about pricing or whether or not it's validated. The first time I came here, service was okay for a weekday dinner. There was a while wait for dinner and servers are always running around because of the workload. It's not the typical Applebees restaurant that I'm used to with less attention from the servers and the rush from table to table, but they get the job done and I don't have a major problem with that--until now. Parking was plentiful at night near the mall so to avoid unjustified parking lot fees, my husband and I walked a block past the high school field to Applebees. There's this unwritten rule or a personal feeling I had when I went into this Applebees last week at the last hour at around 10PM (they close at 11pm.) I never try to go into restaurants near closing time because of the lack of service and who knows if the food is still fresh as everybody rushes to close. Unfortunately, I saw the Applebees commercial on TV featuring their realburgers and I couldn't stop the craving for one. As I went in with my husband, the hostess seated us right away and gave us the standard comment that our server will be right with us. Yeah, right. As I looked around, I saw a male server personally chatting up with some customers, taking his time, but his customers at least, had a drink on their table. Our female server, whom we presume is our server, since she was walking up and down our aisle, went to check how other customers are doing, but failed to pay us any attention. She could have at least said, "I'll be right with you" or "would you like something to drink for now?" but she ended up passing us, going to the table next to us and do some extra chatting. My husband said out loud that he was ready to order a few times. It seemed like ten minutes have past, but nobody paid us any attention. We were starving because we didn't eat much that day. My husband flagged down the hostess again and told her he was ready to order, but again, just like a robot, she told us that our server would be right with us. I know it's not her job, but at least she could flag down someone who can help us. I had questions about the menu too because they only applied a neon yellow realburger sticker on the menu with no prices or any information. I would have thought with all this TV promotion, Applebees could have promoted it better on a menu. On top of this, the chair next to me was a little ripped, contributing to my ripped seat phobia. This situation with nobody serving us made my husband angry and a minute later, we stood up, walked past our assumed server, walked past our hostess, and out the door. The hostess opened her mouth as if to say something, but didn't. I guess losing us as a customer isn't that big of a deal especially when it was almost time to close. I spent maybe less than twenty minutes there. I considered other Applebees locations, but it was already very late. I ended up going to Georgia Diner and having a good burger time.

The service was slow, even for an Applebees. The kitchen was largely unwilling to accommodate dietary restrictions (which is disappointing for a chain, especially one that I've found to be pretty accommodating in other locations). Also, it was a weekend and everyone was wearing football jerseys. and maybe 3/4 of the staff was wearing Tom Brad jerseys. Maybe I'm missing something about Elmhurst- but I can't think that Brady jerseys in NY are good for business. anyway, if you're at the Queens Mall, you're already in the burbs, so there's not much better than this around- but objectively speaking, compared to the great food that is a short train ride away, Applebees is not worth more than 2.
I like my neighborhood Applebees!  Good service, spacious, and no crowds on a Saturday afternoon!

i have been visiting here once every two weeks at least for two years now. foods here always been top notch, but the quality of service keeps getting worse. the workers/servers never seem happy and are too eager to eager out of there (we always go late, due to work hours). also a down point of this place the amount of time one has to weight in-order to get food + waiting for seating, especially on weekends its terrible for a simple meal.  just avoid this place on weekends

After a long day in QCM my family and I love to go Applebees. You will not be wasting you time here the food is great and the service is just as great as the food. They do tend to have a 15-20 min. wait but that because of the great food and services. BTW if you don't know what to get I would say steak&parm w/ shrimp and chocolate overload for desert

the appelbees is one place where i love to go and just have good food especially in the mall! the best part is that u shop and then you eat! i have been to applebees plenty of times before... the one in the mall is not bad.. i went couple of times but recently i went with my friend and i must say this is the worst experience ever! the staff was very rude! especially the women who helps you get to a table was very rude! did not look at us for atleast 5 minutes cause she was busy talking to her co worker! it took half an hour for appetizer to arrive and an even longer time for the entree to arrive! the waiter was mean! he did not apologize for the delay and just did not pay attention! he was also busy talking to some chick.. maybe his girlfriend!  they even forgot to get some dip for my appetizer! will not go again unless they change their very unfriendly staff! i rather walk and go the the one on 63rd drive! where the service is much much better!
